headline.main: Kremlin and Rebel Envoys Discuss Peace for Chechnya

lead_paragraph: For the first time since war erupted 27 months ago between Russia and Chechnya, a separatist province, top envoys from the Kremlin and the Chechen rebel government met publicly here today to discuss peace. Both the Chechen official and Viktor G. Kazantsev, President Vladimir V. Putin's representative in southwest Russia where Chechnya is located, later told the Interfax news service that the talks were productive and that they would continue.
abstract: Top envoys from Kremlin and Chechnya meet publicly in Moscow to discuss peace for first time since war erupted 27 months ago between Russia and Chechnya; both envoys say talks are productive (M)
